de.larssh.utils

Class Either<A,B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.utils.Either<A,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - first type of value
    B - second type of value

    public class Either<A,B>
extends Object
    A container object which contains a value matching either one or another type represented by <A> and <B>.

    The value can be accessed in a type-safe way using getFirst() and getSecond().

    Additional methods to process the value based on its type and resulting in a fixed typed instance are provided, such as map(Function, Function).

    This is a value-based class; use of identity-sensitive operations (including reference equality (==), identity hash code, or synchronization) on instances of Optional may have unpredictable results and should be avoided.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        @Deprecated
public static <A,B> Either<A,B> of(@Nullable
                                               A first,
                                               @Nullable
                                               B second)
        Deprecated. This is a convenience method for special cases only. Use ofFirst(A) and ofSecond(B) where possible.
        Returns an Either object describing the given value. One of both parameters has to be non null (means being set), the other one has to be null (means being not set).
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of first value
        B - type of second value
        Parameters:
        first - value of first type or null
        second - value of second type or null
        Returns:
        an Either object with the given value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if both parameters are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if both parameters are non-null

      • ifFirstIsPresent

        public void ifFirstIsPresent(Consumer<? super A> consumer)

      • map

        @Nullable
public <T> T map(Function<? super A,? extends T> firstFunction,
                           Function<? super B,? extends T> secondFunction)
        If value is of first type functionA is applied, else value is of second type and functionB is applied. The resulting value is returned.

        Example: The first type is somehow used for user input, while the second one is used for system default values. 

         Either<String, Number> either = Either.ofFirst("123");

 String text = either.map(s -> "Changed", n -> "System default");
 long value = either.map(Long::parseLong, Number::longValue);
        Type Parameters:
        T - resulting type
        Parameters:
        firstFunction - function to map value, if it is of first type
        secondFunction - function to map value, if it is of second type
        Returns:
        result after mapping the value using either functionA or functionB

      • mapFirst

        @Nullable
public B mapFirst(Function<? super A,? extends B> function)
        If the value is of second type function is applied and the resulting value is returned else the value is of first type and returned as-is.

        Example: The first type is somehow used for user input, while the second one is used for system default values. 

         Either<String, Number> either = Either.ofFirst("123");

 String text = either.map(s -> "Changed", n -> "System default");
 Number value = either.mapFirst(Long::parseLong);
        Parameters:
        function - function to map value, if it is of first type
        Returns:
        value if it is of second type, else result after mapping it using function

      • mapSecond

        @Nullable
public A mapSecond(Function<? super B,? extends A> function)
        If the value is of first type function is applied and the resulting value is returned else the value is of second type and returned as-is.

        Example: The first type is somehow used for user input, while the second one is used for system default values. 

         Either<String, Number> either = Either.ofFirst(123);

 String text = either.map(s -> "Changed", n -> "System default");
 String displayValue = either.mapSecond(Number::toString);
        Parameters:
        function - function to map value, if it is of second type
        Returns:
        value if it is of first type, else result after mapping it using function
